meanings.definition: To remove water from a boat by using a bucket or pump.
meanings.sent1: After the storm, the sailors bailed out the water from the boat.
meanings.sent2: The fisherman bailed the water out of his small boat.
meanings.sent3: The boat was leaking, so they bailed out the water like a team of superheroes.
meanings.sent4: She bailed out the water with determination, as if fighting a flood.
meanings.sent5: The act of bailing out water from the boat was exhausting but necessary for their safety.

meanings.definition: To leave or abandon a situation or place suddenly.
meanings.sent1: When the movie got boring, she bailed and went to get popcorn.
meanings.sent2: He bailed on the party when he realized he had forgotten his wallet.
meanings.sent3: The cat bailed on the game of chase, deciding it was time for a nap.
meanings.sent4: She bailed on the conversation like a magician disappearing in a puff of smoke.
meanings.sent5: The student bailed on the boring lecture and went for a walk in the park.

meanings.definition: To release someone from custody by posting bail.
meanings.sent1: The lawyer bailed her client out of jail after posting bail.
meanings.sent2: He bailed his friend out of trouble by paying the bail amount.
meanings.sent3: The kind stranger bailed the young man out of jail, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: She bailed her brother out of a tough situation by posting bail.
meanings.sent5: Bailing someone out of jail can be a costly but necessary act of kindness.
